description.content:
Retrieves the accounts the authenticated user is part of. 
Note: for service users only the account where the user is defined is returned.

header.description: (Required) The id of the account where the request is executed.

description.content: Retrieves a list of all the custom field definitions.

query.description: Number of items to include inside the page.
Number of items that are skipped to reach the desired page.
The ids of the folders where you want to retrieve resources from. More complex behavior can be set by also using the 'locationStrategy'.

Options:
location: all resources located strictly in the folders from 'location' param (default).
lineage: all resources located in the folders specified in 'location' param, as well as the subfolders
bloodline: all resources located in the folders specified in 'location' param, as well as the ancestor folders
genealogy: resources located in the folders specified in the 'location' param together with subfolders and ancestors.
A comma separated list of fields used to sort the resources in the response. Each field can have a unary negative to imply descending sort order.

A comma separated list of fields to include in the response.
        Every value in the list should either consist of a top-level property name (excluding the items envelope for endpoints returning lists) or refer to a property of a top-level property of type object, in the following form: "toplevelpropertyname.subpropertyname".
        When this query parameter is omitted, default resource representations are returned (excludng fields marked as optional). The same applies to nested objects when just specifiying the top-level property name, without explicitly listing sub-property names. When specifying the fields query parameter, only the specified fields are returned.
        The id property is always returned.

description.content: Downloads a completed target file version via an export operation.

description.content: Polls a target file version via an import operation. The new version can be seen on the file versions once the status is "completed".

header.description: (Required) The id of the account where the request is executed.

description.content: Accepts a task. The authenticated user will become the owner of the accepted task.

header.description: (Required) The id of the account where the request is executed.

description.content: Rejects a task. The authenticated user will be removed from the task's assignee list.

header.description: (Required) The id of the account where the request is executed.

description.content: Completes a task. The task will be marked as "completed".

header.description: (Required) The id of the account where the request is executed.

description.content: Releases the task from its owner. The other task assignee will be able to accept it.

header.description: (Required) The id of the account where the request is executed.

description.content: Reclaims task. The task is currently owned by somebody else, but it is assigned to the authenticated user. The task will be released from the current owner and assigned to the authenticated user.

header.description: (Required) The id of the account where the request is executed.

description.content: Assigns a task. Task assignees will be updated.

location: all resources located strictly in the folders from 'location' param (default).
lineage: all resources located in the folders specified in 'location' param, as well as the subfolders
bloodline: all resources located in the folders specified in 'location' param, as well as the ancestor folders
genealogy: resources located in the folders specified in the 'location' param together with subfolders and ancestors.
A comma separated list of fields used to sort the resources in the response. Each field can have a unary negative to imply descending sort order.

A comma separated list of fields to include in the response.
        Every value in the list should either consist of a top-level property name (excluding the items envelope for endpoints returning lists) or refer to a property of a top-level property of type object, in the following form: "toplevelpropertyname.subpropertyname".
        When this query parameter is omitted, default resource representations are returned (excludng fields marked as optional). The same applies to nested objects when just specifiying the top-level property name, without explicitly listing sub-property names. When specifying the fields query parameter, only the specified fields are returned.
        The id property is always returned.
